item.title: Activator utilities
item.author: koen@linker.io (Koen)
item.description: Dependency injection (DI) is a well-known technique that helps in writing more maintainable code. .NET has excellent support for Dependency injection and is heavily used in platforms such as ASP.NET Core. .NET and Dependency injection In .NET, Dependencies are typically resolved through an interface IServiceProvider. This is backed by a DI container (ServiceProvider) that holds all registrations of possible instances, including their lifetimes. This means that the .NET DI Container is responsible for both managing registrations, lifetimes, and hooking them up together.
